intro: Hyoseris baetica, commonly known as the Iberian sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Hyoseris baetica is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in full sun.
